comment: This professor was not available for the first several weeks of the class. I had a friend pass away on the day of an exam, in which I did extremely poorly on. I tried reaching out to let the professor know, but I never got a response. A clear self taught class.

I signed up for a certain professor but I received her for an online course. She doesn't engage with the online course, she still hasn't graded work from the beginning of the year, and she doesn't teach or explain anything. Don't take her if you have a choice.

TERRIBLE instructor. Extremely lazy, does not respond to any communication attempts unless you involve her superior, and took an ENTIRE MONTH to grade a 3-QUESTION midterm. I'm not even sure if she actually knows how to code because there are so many errors on the assignments she makes it's crazy that she's actually teaching at a Uni.

You honestly don't even need her.  The work is all online and she's just there, almost like a parent supervisor during a field trip. She doesn't teach anything, the SI does most of the work. The manual grading is terrible compared to the autograder used on gradescope. Also, they aren't really concise with the directions for codes so look elsewhere.
The course work is easy. The instructions and announcements are unclear. Issues and questions go unresolved. There are still unanswered questions from week 1 and we are in week 4.

She has very little enthusiasm and life when she teaches. She does a small review of the lesson, calls role, and sits at her desk until the end of class. I would get emails as late as a couple weeks. Really made me feel as if I was on my own.

She tended to take multiple days to answer simple emails and was confusing on the responses. therefor you had to follow up with a clarification email to then wait days for that one. She didn't help much in class with questions either and was very unclear on advice.. However I did appreciate the class time she let us work on our assignments.

Class is best when she let's us come in and do our work, which is most days. Sometimes she'll unnecessarily interrupt us to try to teach concepts our lecture teacher already went over. She wasn't very good at answering questions.
